Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Java class for UDP-based communication with OpenTracker for live synchronization of peer information using Java NIO's non-blocking DatagramChannel.

Class Description: The OpentrackerLiveSync class handles UDP communication with an OpenTracker server for peer synchronization. It uses non-blocking I/O to send peer information packets to a multicast group. The class maintains a queue of outgoing messages and processes them in batches.

Attributes:
- toSend: TransferQueue<ByteBuffer> - Thread-safe queue holding outgoing peer information packets
- channel: DatagramChannel - The UDP communication channel for sending data
- id: byte[] - 4-byte random identifier for this client
- running: volatile boolean - Flag controlling the operation of the sender thread
- HEADER_LENGTH: static final int - Constant for header size (8 bytes)
- PEER_LENGTH: static final int - Constant for peer information size (28 bytes)
- PEERS_PER_PACKET: static final int - Constant for maximum peers per packet (50)

Methods:
- OpentrackerLiveSync() -> None - Constructor initializes random client ID
- start() -> None - Initializes UDP channel and starts sender thread
- incomingPacket(MessageBase msg) -> None - Processes incoming messages and queues valid peer requests
- send() -> None - Worker method that sends batched peer information packets
- stop() -> None - Stops the sender thread and closes the channel

Input Parameters for Methods:
- incomingPacket: msg [MessageBase] - The incoming message to process
- (Other methods take no explicit parameters)

Output/Return Values:
- All methods return void except the constructor
- Methods primarily affect class state and perform I/O operations
